body: @bgchun Sure, I'll take a look this afternoon.

I created another PR for REEF-1002, because I failed to reopen #676 after merging & rebasing the branch to the master branch.
@bgchun @afchung Could you take a look?
@yunseong This looks good. I will test and merge.

@afchung I've made a pass.  Overall, the change looks great. I left some comments in the code snippet and those are the high-level comments:
- Could you edit the commit message which describes this PR?
- REEF-501 will change many parts in this code, but it seems to work well under the current assumption (i.e., One Tasklet is launched only once at a moment).
- I don't have a better idea for your question in `VortexFuture.java`. @bgchun Any thought?
Looks good, I'll merge.
Looks good to me, I'll merge.

@bgchun @yunseong Merged and rebased. Please have another look. Thanks!

@jwang98052 's build failure doesn't seem to have anything to do with my changes. @tcNickolas , would you happen to know what may have caused the build error? I was able to build on my machine. Thanks!

Check NuGet version on the machine which produces error
http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/reef-dev/201511.mbox/%3CBLUPR03MB293C466552231C5C30BCFD2D2070%40BLUPR03MB293.namprd03.prod.outlook.com%3E
@afchung This looks good. I added a couple of comments.

@afchung I've taken another look and it looks great. I have a question though: what if user requests to cancel a Tasklet which has not been submitted? I guess this has no effect immediately, but it will cancel the Tasklet with that ID afterward, since the id would be in the `taskletsToCancel`.
If it is true, it brings up another requirement of the interface @bgchun mentioned; we can look up the TaskletId, so only submitted Tasklet id can be canceled. Does it make sense?

@yunseong you are right in your assumption. The (relatively strong) assumption I was making in this PR is that a cancelled tasklet will eventually be scheduled, since a user will not be able to cancel a tasklet without a `VortexFuture`, which will not be created if we did not queue it up in the `VortexMaster`. I think we should add an interface to retrieve the status of a tasklet as well.
@bgchun @yunseong Addressed comments. Please have another look. Thanks!
@afchung Oh, you're right. I missed that a tasklet only can be canceled via `VortexFuture`. Thanks for the clarification.
I'll take a look.
@shulmanb Done with first pass. No major issues. Thanks!
Uploaded new iteration. Please take a look.
@shulmanb still a few minor issues. Thanks!
Fixed them. Please take a look.
will test and merge

Looks good to me, I'll test and merge.

This looks good to me, I'll test and merge.
I will review it.

@zerg-junior Hmm, it would appear that in the YARN case, this is not taking the application ID that YARN passes us, but instead takes the job identifier that the user provides. Could you change it such that it preserves the original behavior? Thanks!
@afchung @bgchun could you take a look?
Thank you!

@yunseong I'm done with a first pass.
Few things:
1. I think the current design allows too much freedom for the user -- mainly, it will be hard for them to know how to generate a `Configuration` for a Vortex job. Personally, I feel that the cleanest way to do this is to switch `VortexConfHelper` into a Builder class and build a `VortexJobObject` (or what have you), using `Configuration` internally and allowing the user to pass in a `Configuration` that is merged with the main `DriverConfiguration` and `VortexMasterConf`. This allows us to utilize Tang to check our `Configuration` parameters for us while exposing a fairly clean interface. What do you think? 
2. There is a `TODO` in `VortexConfHelper` for REEF-1000 that configures the number of threads for the thread pool on callbacks. Should we address it in this PR?

Thanks!
@afchung @yunseong This looks good. I will test and merge
Also, it seems like the build fails checkstyle. Could you take a look?

@afchung Thanks for the great comment.
1. I agree the current code is too flexible. So are you suggesting to have a builder in `VortexConfHelper`, which creates an object we can use to build configuration internally, so users can figure out easily how to create configuration? Am I understood correctly?
2. I exposed `FUTURE_CALLBACK_THREAD_POOL_SIZE` in `VortexMasterConf.CONF`, but not enabled at the `VortexConfHelper`. I'll address it here also.

It seems an unused import was left when I rebased the branch. I'll fix it and let you know when I'm ready for the next round. Thanks!

@yunseong I agree it is somewhat doubling the work, but `VortexMasterConf` will also need to merge with `DriverConfiguration`, where we can potentially want to allow users to configure something at `DriverConfiguration` (e.g. jobIdentifier). I'm not sure if there is a way to merge the ConfigurationModules themselves into one ConfigurationModule that allows users to easily see what parameters they need to set. The Builder object was the solution I came up with to "merge" the two ConfigurationModules.
It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.
It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.

@afchung Sure. Could you please clarify what are the intended differences between the named parameters `LaunchID`, `JobIdentifier` and `ApplicationIdentifier` ? The `EvaluatorConfiguration` (lines 60-61) binds `LaunchID` and `ApplicationIdentifier` to the same optional parameter, which `AllocatedEvaluatorImpl`  (line 301) resets to whatever value its `jobIdentifier`  field contains.
Hi, @afchung . It's updated and rebased. For the `SerializerFileSpool`, `deleteOnExit` is used when `delete` fails.
@afchung I made some changes. Could you have a look? Thanks!
Looks good, I'll test and merge.
We all agree that we don't want to merge this PR, but rather hunt for the root cause and fix it. Maybe we should close this PR, and open a new one once the fix is found?

I only discovered the difference in behavior when I was running the Driver Restart scenario from C#, and it seems like the recovery wasn't working due to the change in `DFSEvaluatorPreserver`. I can look deeper into it tomorrow.

@afchung That's a good point. Since exceptions are not declared in the interface, it seems that we have no choice but writing the description in the body of javadoc. I've added a comment there. Could you take a look? Thanks!
Looks good, I'll test and merge

Judging from the `ApplicationIdentifier` javadoc, this may solve the issue. Could you please rerun C# DriverRestart to (dis)prove this ? I lack necessary infrastructure to do it myself.

Also, do we know how this fits in with the end goal of REEF-289?
@markusweimer I made 3rd commit at the same time you started review. Please refer to the latest.

I've done a surface level pass on this. Some global comments:
- Please remove all commented out code added in this PR.
- Why does this rename `LOGGER` to `Logger`? This seems purely stylistic and should probably go to a separate PR.
- This makes incompatible changes to `public` members in `public` classes. I'm OK with that, as they should never have been `public` in the first place. Not sure how to deal with that. Maybe we need to declare 0.14 to be an incompatible release?
@jwang98052 OK, I will do another pass.
@jwang98052 Done with my 2nd pass.
Have addressed review comments and pushed in the changes. @markusweimer thanks for the review!  Please review again.

@zerg-junior I see what the issue is. On the C# side, the Driver Restart code assumes that the jobIdentifier is the YARN application ID, which was why the example failed. I've filed [REEF-1071](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1071) for this.
I'm also +1 for clarifying the fields.
I have a PR out for REEF-1071. Thanks!
Hi, @tcNickolas . It looks good to me. I'll test and merge this.

@tcNickolas . Could you test this PR again? During building, 162 violations occur. The majority of the violations are SA1121 in `Tang` module, but the other modules like `Wake` also have violations, too.

Hi, @afchung . Is this PR safe enough to skip the deprecation process? If I missed some discussion on this issue, could you give me some pointer to that? If possible, please update the JIRA description, too.
Sure, I'll double-check. Maybe VS cached build of some projects and didn't re-build them with StyleCop enabled.

@dongjoon-hyun It looks like the only thing to worry about here is whether `IDriverConnection` has to go through a deprecation phase for the method signature change and the sealing of its implementing classes; however, `IDriverConnection` is not something that should be implemented by the user anyhow, and it should have been marked `[DriverSide]` and `[RuntimeImplementation]`, though such annotations do not exist in C# as of right now (perhaps we should add them?). On another note, I don't think anyone is currently using Driver restart, but I'll call it out on the dev mailing list, just to be sure. Thanks!
I'll also mark `YarnUtilities` to be `@Private` as well.
This PR includes `testMicroBenchmark` just for review. After review, I'll replace `equals` with `equalsNew` and delete `testMicroBenchmark`.

Hi, all.
Sorry for late update. To trigger another round of reviews, I rebased and updated the code according to the advices. It means  **"Inject-a-Factory" pattern with a given Injector**. 

To implement `RemoteManagerFactory`,
- `DefaultRemoteManagerFactory` has a package-private constructor having all default parameters for a package-private constructor of `DefaultRemoteManagerImplementation` in the same package.
- `DefaultRemoteManagerFactory` receives `Injector` from Tang instead of creating by itself.
- In various `getInstance` functions, `DefaultRemoteManagerFactory` calls `forkInjector` and binds volatile variables.

I didn't make `ConfigurationModule` because I think the current pattern is enough. If I missed something except this, please let me know.
Thanks! I've done a pass.
@johnyangk @yunseong @bgchun Please have a look. Thanks!

@bgchun @yunseong @johnyangk Looking deeper into the code, I've found that there are too many places in the code that relies on the assumption of a 1:1 mapping between Tasklets and Futures. Another thing that complicates matters is the assumption of a 1:1 mapping between a message from the worker and the task that it is reporting back about. It seems like the thing to do first should be to map worker reports to multiple Tasklets before mapping a Future to multiple Tasklets. I will close this so no one accidentally merges this before it's ready. Thanks, and sorry for any confusion!
@bgchun @yunseong @johnyangk Please have a look and let me know what you think. Thanks!
@afchung This looks good to me in general. But the tests failed due to a minor checkstyle violation. Could you fix it first? Thanks!
@yunseong Fixed it. Please have another look. Thanks!

@afchung 
I am closing this pull request since we lack a well-defined way to get a job id before one  clarifies the use of identifiers. Relevant discussion should now move to [REEF-1066](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-1066)
@afchung I took another look. Again, this looks good (one of the tests fail, but not relevant to this change). I've left very minor comments. @bgchun @johnyangk Do you have any other comments?

Agreed, for the case where instances are provided, `bindViolatile` is the right approach. Having such a method that completely sidesteps Tang is concerning, but let's leave that to future work. I will test and merge this.
@zerg-junior Can you please resolve conflicts and rebase?
@dongjoon-hyun Seems like there aren't any opinions on the dev mailing list. What are your thoughts?
@yunseong Fixed, please have another look. Thanks!

@markusweimer Fixed and rebased. In terms of the goals of REEF-289, this provides tighter concurrency guarantees. Currently, the Task runs in a separate thread. If the Task ended while a heartbeat came in, both threads would modify the task status without using any locks or synchronization primitives, leading to a possibly uncertain state. Thanks!
@markusweimer Please review it again and let me know when it is done. I guess I need to rebase and resolve conflict before the merge.
Indeed, when I deleted cs/bin folder there were plenty more violations. I've updated PR to have them fixed
